title: Introduction
text: packaged example data subset package wastdr, included dependency keep package streamlined small. caveat, data considered synthetic real analysis conducted . marine turtle hatchlings emerge nest scamper towards believe fastest way ocean, form fan tracks sand. fan can approximated circle segment leftmost rightmost track’s compass bearing. number tracks fan can sometimes hard precisely count, can estimated lower upper estimate (e.g. ca 50 tracks, min 30 max 70 tracks). raw data documented help(fans). hatchlings get direction water completely wrong wander , forming outlier track. See also help(outliers). outliers nests included fans. biggest orientation help hatchlings dim starlight ocean, dark sand dune behind . Since hatchlings wander towards lightest horizon, orientation particularly vulnerable artificial light sources. recorded, known, bearings nest location. See also help(lights). light sources nests included fans. simplicity, data transmuted required columns default naming scheme. saves us specifying column names calling addCircleSectorMinMax addCircleSectorMid. processing steps kept inst/generate_data.R. data show : fans_tracks: Hatchling tracks form main fan originating nest spreading . fans_mean: mean direction main fan. hatchlings went. fans_water: direction water. meant go. outlier_segments: Outlier tracks. folks got completely wrong. light_segments_natural: Known natural light sources. light_segments_artificial: Known artificial light sources. tend disorient hatchlings. Example data addCircleSectorMinMax: Example data addCircleSectorMid:

title: Introduction
text: location nests, show: white circle indicating nest radius 5m. main turtle hatchling tracks fan blue circle segment start_angle end_angle radius 10m. thin black segment pointing towards water. thin blue segment pointing towards mean bearing. thin red segment outlier. thin yellow segment pointing towards natural light source. thin orange segment pointing towards artificial light source.
code: leaflet_basemap(l_height = 500, l_width = 700) %>%   # clearBounds releases setView from leaflet_basemap   # so that addCircleSectorMid/MinMax can expandLimits   leaflet::clearBounds() %>%   leaflet::addCircles(     data = fans_tracks,     lat = ~lat,     lng = ~lon,     color = "white",     weight = 2,     radius = 5   ) %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = light_segments_artificial) %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = light_segments_natural) %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = fans_mean) %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = fans_water) %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = outlier_segments) %>%   addCircleSectorMinMax(data = fans_tracks)

what: An R wrapper for the Leaflet.Circle-sector plugin
title: An R wrapper for the Leaflet.Circle-sector plugin
text: R package leaflet.circlesector wraps Leaflet plugin Leaflet.Circle-sector, providing way draw circle segments leaflet maps. can used visualise marine turtle hatchling (mis)orientation time nest emergence. See vignette("Introduction") explanation packaged example data desired visualisation.
code: library(leaflet.circlesector) data("fans_tracks") data("fans_mean") data("fans_water") data("outlier_segments")  leaflet_basemap(l_height = 500, l_width = 700) %>%      leaflet::clearBounds() %>%      leaflet::addCircles(         data = fans_tracks,         lat = ~ lat,         lng = ~ lon,         color = 'white',         weight = 2,         radius = 5     ) %>%     addCircleSectorMid(data = fans_mean) %>%     addCircleSectorMid(data = fans_water) %>%     addCircleSectorMid(data = outlier_segments) %>%     addCircleSectorMinMax(data = fans_tracks) %>%      leaflet::setView(115.0245, -21.46, 19)

title: An R wrapper for the Leaflet.Circle-sector plugin
text: can install development version leaflet.circlesector GitHub :

what: Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using bearing and spread — addCircleSectorMid
title: Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using bearing and spread — addCircleSectorMid
text: methor wraps setSector method Leaflet.Circle-sector, Leaflet plugin extending L.Circle.

title: Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using bearing and spread — addCircleSectorMid
code: addCircleSectorMid(   map,   data,   lat = "lat",   lon = "lon",   bearing = "bearing",   angle = "angle",   radius = "radius",   weight = "weight",   colour = "colour",   label = "label",   popup = "popup" )

title: Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using bearing and spread — addCircleSectorMid
text: map leaflet map data data frame row represents circle sector columns lat, lon, min, mid, max. lat column name string holding Latitude circle mid point map WGS 84 decimal degrees. Default: "lat". lon column name string holding Longitude circle mid point map WGS 84 decimal degrees. Default: "lon". bearing column name string holding main bearing sector decimal degrees, counted clockwise North. Default: "bearing". angle max column name string holding angle sector decimal degrees, centered main direction mid. Default: "angle". radius column name string holding radius circle metres. Default: "radius". weight column name string holding weight circle. Default: "weight. colour column name string holding colour circle. Default: "colour". Example values: "blue", "red", "#3388ff". label column name string holding label content circle. Default: "label". popup column name string holding popup content circle. Default: "popup".

title: Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using bearing and spread — addCircleSectorMid
code: if (FALSE) { data("fans_mean")  leaflet_basemap(l_height = 500, l_width = 700) %>%   leaflet::clearBounds() %>%   addCircleSectorMid(data = fans_mean) }

Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using start and end
angles — addCircleSectorMinMax
title:
Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using start and end
angles — addCircleSectorMinMax
text: methor wraps setAngles method Leaflet.Circle-sector, Leaflet plugin extending L.Circle.

title:
Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using start and end
angles — addCircleSectorMinMax
code: addCircleSectorMinMax(   map,   data,   lat = "lat",   lon = "lon",   start_angle = "start_angle",   end_angle = "end_angle",   radius = "radius",   weight = "weight",   colour = "colour",   label = "label",   popup = "popup" )

title:
Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using start and end
angles — addCircleSectorMinMax
text: map leaflet map data data frame row represents circle sector columns lat, lon, min, mid, max. lat column name string holding Latitude circle mid point map WGS 84 decimal degrees. Default: "lat". lon column name string holding Longitude circle mid point map WGS 84 decimal degrees. Default: "lon". start_angle column name string holding startAngle sector decimal degrees, counted clockwise North. Default: "start_angle". end_angle column name string holding endAngle sector decimal degrees, counted clockwise North. Default: "end_angle". radius column name string holding radius circle metres. Default: "radius". weight column name string holding weight circle. Default: "weight. colour column name string holding colour circle. Default: "colour". Example values: "blue", "red", "#3388ff". label column name string holding label content circle. Default: "label". popup column name string holding popup content circle. Default: "popup".

title:
Add Circle sectors to a Leaflet map from a dataframe using start and end
angles — addCircleSectorMinMax
code: if (FALSE) { data("fans_tracks")  leaflet_basemap(l_height = 500, l_width = 700) %>%   leaflet::clearBounds() %>%   addCircleSectorMinMax(data = fans_tracks) }

text: Nest fans described encounter_source_id UUID TurtleNestEncounter encounter_when Datetime encounter encounter_latitude Latitude encounter decimal degrees WGS84 encounter_laongitude Longitude encounter decimal degrees WGS84 encounter_name nest tag known, unique ID nest encounter_species species turtle laid nest bearing_leftmost_track_degrees leftmost fan angle bearing bearing_rightmost_track_degrees rightmost fan angle bearing no_tracks_main_group number hatchling tracks main group tracks, best estimate no_tracks_main_group_min number hatchling tracks main group tracks, lowest estimate no_tracks_main_group_max number hatchling tracks main group tracks, highest estimate outlier_tracks_present Whether outlier tracks present path_to_sea_comments comments path sea, e.g. whether obstructed hatchling_emergence_time_known Whether exact time emergence known light_sources_present hatchling_emergence_time hatchling_emergence_time_accuracy cloud_cover_at_emergence datetime calendar_date_awst calendar_date_awst_text calendar_year turtle_date turtle_date_awst_text season season_week iso_week
